arm_group.description: Water immersion during colonoscope insertion and room air insufflation during colonoscope withdrawal.
Standard room air insufflation during both colonoscope insertion and withdrawal.

brief_summary.textblock:
Water-aided insertion of the colonoscope has been repeatedly proven to beneficial in terms
      of lower discomfort and need for sedation during colonoscopy. Patients with inflammatory
      bowel diseases (IBD) undergo repeated colonoscopy in course of their disease. According to
      our preliminary experience, water immersion could be beneficial while scoping these
      patients. As far as the investigators know, water-aided colonoscopy has never been studied
      in this indication. Results of our trial might support use of water-aided colonoscopy in
      common practice and decrease associated discomfort in IBD patients.

clinical_study.brief_title: Water-aided Colonoscopy in Inflammatory Bowel Disease Patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  known diagnosis of inflammatory bowel disease

          -  planned diagnostic outpatient colonoscopy

          -  signed informed consent

          -  willingness to undergo unsedated colonoscopy

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  ulcerative proctitis

          -  bowel resection longer than ileocecal resection

          -  requirement for sedation

intervention.description: Water immersion means infusion of room temperature water during colonoscope insertion without air insufflation.

intervention.other_name: Room air insufflation during colonoscope insertion.

clinical_study.official_title: Water-aided Colonoscopy in Patients With Inflammatory Bowel Disease - a Single-center, Single-blinded Randomized Trial

primary_outcome.description: Successful unsedated colonoscopy is defined as reaching the cecum by using given insertion technique without administering sedation.
primary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of each colonoscopy

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Discomfort level using visual continuous scale 0-10 (0 = no pain, 10 = worst pain).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of each colonoscopy

secondary_outcome.description: Cecal intubation time is defined as time between colonoscope introduction into the anus and reaching the cecum.
